noun.description: Botany and Mycology. The middle layer of the wall of any of several types of three-layered spores (e.g. the megaspore of a clubmoss or the zygospore of a zygnemaceous alga).
Mycology. A one-celled teleutospore occurring in species of rust fungus which normally produce two-celled teleutospores.

origin: Late 19th century; earliest use found in Mordecai Cooke (1825–1914), naturalist and mycologist. From meso- + spore.
